alert.note: Alert for Newton (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 27 at 8:56PM EST until March 02 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Chicago IL has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Indiana... Iroquois River near Foresman affecting Newton County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY MORNING TO THURSDAY MORNING... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD WATCH... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Iroquois River from Near I-65 east of Foresman downstream to near US-41 north of Kentland, including the Foresman gauge. * WHEN...From Tuesday morning to Thursday morning. * IMPACTS...At 18.5 feet, 1000 South Road threatened north of the river near Brook. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM CST Monday the stage was 17.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Tuesday morning to a crest of 18.4 feet early Wednesday morning. It will then fall below flood stage early Thursday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: These forecasts are based on observed precipitation as well as forecast precipitation 48 hours into the future. Changes to the rainfall forecast, or any additional rainfall after 48 hours, may cause changes to these river forecasts. A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/Chicago and water.weather.gov The next statement is expected by Tuesday afternoon.
